title: Bill Belichick: Patrick Chung 'one of the best tacklers' I've had at safety | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
text:
FOXBORO — At today's press conference, coach Bill Belichick stressed the core defensive principle he learned from his father, Steve Belichick, who was a coach and scout, and Bill Parcells, a Hall-of-Famer with whom Belichick coached as an assistant with the Giants — tackling.
"The most important thing is to get 11 guys on the field who can tackle," Belichick said, who noted probably the best he's coached is former Giants linebacker Lawrence Taylor.
As for today's Patriots, Belichick named safeties Devin McCourty, Patrick Chung.
"Devin McCourty is an outstanding tackler," Belichick said. "Chung is one of the best tacklers that I've had at safety."
Chung, who has made 400 combined tackles in his seven years in the league — including one with the Eagles in 2013 — plays close to the line of scrimmage a lot in the Pats' current scheme in addition to a lot of work on special teams.
Criticized at times for his lack of coverage skills in his initial stint with the Patriots, Chung's ability to bring down runners seems why he has become so valuable to Belichick.
